article.title: Games and Big Data: A Scalable Multi-Dimensional Churn Prediction Model

multiple_choice_question.text: What do the different colors of the curves in Figure 1 represent?
choices: Different player profiles with distinct survival expectations.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 2 tell us about the performance of the Survival Ensemble model compared to the Cox Regression model for predicting churn level?
choices: The Survival Ensemble model is more accurate across the entire level range.
The Cox Regression model is more accurate for players with low levels.
The Survival Ensemble model is only accurate for players with high levels.

multiple_choice_question.text: Similar to Figure 2, what insight does Figure 3 provide regarding the prediction of churn based on playtime?
choices: Both models perform equally well for playtime prediction.
The Cox Regression model is more accurate for players with high playtime.
The Survival Ensemble model is consistently more accurate than the Cox Regression model for predicting playtime.
The accuracy of both models increases with higher playtime.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can we conclude from Figure 4 about the error rates of the Survival Ensemble model compared to the Cox Regression model for both playtime and level predictions?
choices: The error rates are identical for both models.
The Survival Ensemble model exhibits lower error rates than the Cox Regression model for both playtime and level predictions.
The Cox Regression model has lower error rates for playtime prediction, while the Survival Ensemble model performs better for level prediction.
The error rates for both models decrease with increasing playtime and level.
